DataElement.preferredName: Person HIV Infection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response that asks if the patient has any state accompanied by evidence of HIV in the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person HIV Infection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._any state accompanied by evidence of HIV in the body (positive test for HIV genome, cDNA, proteins, antigens, or antibodies); may be medically asymptomatic or symptomatic; prefer AIDS when appropriate._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: HIV Infection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: any state accompanied by evidence of HIV in the body (positive test for HIV genome, cDNA, proteins, antigens, or antibodies); may be medically asymptomatic or symptomatic; prefer AIDS when appropriate.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An infection caused by the human immunodeficiency virus.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of HIV infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have poorly controlled HIV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a known history of testing positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or known acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) are the following criteria met:  patient is generally healthy from an HIV perspective and on a stable antiretroviral regimen for greater than 6 months, no AIDS-defining conditions in the past 12 months other than historically low CD4+ cell counts, and has an undetectable viral load on standard assays?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is HIV-positive are the following criteria met: patient is on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART), there is no requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infections, CD4 count above 250 cells/mcL and has an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based tests?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient known to have human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is HIV-positive are the following criteria met: patient is on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART) that does not include strong or moderate CYP3A4 inducers or inhibitors, there is no requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infections, CD4 count above 250 cells/mcL and has an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based tests?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), does the patient have the following? a. A stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART) b. No requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infections c. A CD4 count above 250 cells/mcL and an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based tests.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: HIV viral load is < 200 copies/mm3 by standard clinical assays.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active infection with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)-infected, patient does not have opportunistic complications of AIDS other than their cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS-related illness) or has known   Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) disease, does  patient have a CD4 count greater than or equal to 200 cells/uL within 30 days before enrollment, off all antiretroviral therapy (prophylaxis treatment) more than 60 days before enrollment and have no evidence of opportunistic infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have no known history of infection with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)?
